body.p:
Maysville, Ky,
April 2, 1862,
Hon B. Magoffin, Governor &c

Sir, Harvey T. Wilson, Eqr, of Covington, some time since became surety for John Willett, of this place, upon a replevin bond for a fine recieved in the Mason Circuit Court, for selling liquor without a license, my recollection is, that the license had run out, and through neglect not renewed in time, Willett has left here, and Mr Wilson, who is a clever gentleman, a loyal citizen, and at present hard run will have the price to pay unless remitted. He asks a remission, and I write with him in doing so,
